lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/jeenius.jeenius.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run jeenius.jeenius.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* The main class for the Jeenius application.
* Initializes the necessary components and handles user interactions.
* Creates an instance of Jeenius with the specified storage file path.
* @param filePath The file path for storing tasks.
* Runs the Jeenius application, processing user commands in a loop.
* The main entry point of the Jeenius application.
* @param args Command-line arguments (not used in this application).
* Parses user input and executes the corresponding command.
* Processes the user input and performs the necessary operations.
* @param input The user's command as a string.
* @param tasks The task list that stores all task.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage handler for saving and loading tasks.
* @throws JeeniusException If the user input is invalid or cannot be processed.
public void parse(String input, TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JeeniusException {
throw new JeeniusException("stop pressing enter without typing anything!");
throw new JeeniusException("bro how do you todo nothing??? ADD A DESCRIPTION FOR YOUR TODO");
throw new JeeniusException("can't even delete a task properly? Use: delete [task number]");
throw new JeeniusException("??? deadline tasks need to be like this: "
Event event = new Event(details[0], times[0], times[1]);
throw new JeeniusException("YOU JEENIUS! use this: "
throw new JeeniusException("Wrong format. Use: mark/unmark [task number]");
throw new JeeniusException("Failed to mark/unmark. Use: mark/unmark [task number]");
throw new JeeniusException("bro what am i supposed to find? enter a keyword");
System.out.println("these are your matching tasks in your list:");
throw new JeeniusException("finding is easy, just use: find [keyword]");
throw new JeeniusException("sorry. i'm not that smart. i have limited available commands");
* Represents an exception specific to the Jeenius application.
* Creates a new JeeniusException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message associated with the exception.
* Manages a list of tasks, providing operations to add, delete, and retrieve tasks.
* Creates a TaskList with an initial set of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks. If null, an empty list is created.
this.tasks = tasks != null ? tasks : new ArrayList<>();
* Finds and returns a list of tasks that contain the specified keyword.
* @param keyword The keyword to search for within task descriptions.
* @return A list of tasks that contain the given keyword (case-insensitive).
* Adds a new task to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Deletes a task from the list based on its index
* @param index The index of the task to be removed.
* Handles reading from and writing to the storage file.
* Creates a Storage instance to manage saving and loading tasks.
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* @return A list of tasks loaded from the file.
* @throws JeeniusException If an error occurs while reading the file.
throw new JeeniusException("unknown task type in file.");
throw new JeeniusException("error loading tasks from file.");
* Saves the list of tasks to the storage file.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be saved.
* @throws JeeniusException If an error occurs while writing to the file.
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws JeeniusException {
throw new JeeniusException("error saving tasks to file.");
* Represents a Deadline task that extends generic Task class.
* A Deadline task contains a description, completion by date and time
* Creates a Deadline task with the input description
* and completion by date and time.
* Task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description Textual description of the Deadline task.
* @param by Deadline's completion by date and time in "d/M/yyyy HHmm" format
* Represents an Event task that extends generic Task class.
* A Event task contains a description, start and end date and time,
* Creates an Event task with the input description
* start date and time, and end date and time.
* Task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description Textual description of the Event task.
* @param from Event's start date and time in "d/M/yyyy HHmm" format
* @param to Event's end date and time in "d/M/yyyy HHmm" format
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Represents a generic task with a description and completion status.
* Serves as parent class for specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a task with input description.
* Task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description Textual description of the task
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Converts the task to a standardized format for file storage.
* This format should be implemented by subclasses to ensure consistency
* in saving and loading tasks from files.
* @return A formatted string representing the task, suitable for file storage
* Represents a ToDo task that extends generic Task class
* A ToDo task contains a description and completion status
* Creates a ToDo task with the input description.
* Task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description Textual description of the ToDo task.
* Handles user interactions by displaying messages and formatting outputs.
* Prints the welcome message at the start of the application,
System.out.println("What can I do for you today?");
* Prints the exit message when the application is terminated.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Prints an error message to the user.
* @param message The error message to be displayed.
* Prints the current task list with numbering.
* @param storage The list of tasks to be displayed.
